title: mich
author: mich
content: I am very excited and looking forward to seeing the new Mission Impossible 7. I am a big fan of Tom Cruise and his role as secret agent Ethan Hunt, the movies that he does always have good action scenes. In his last movie, Tom Cruise did this scene where he had to wear some special gloves that stick to glass windows and had to climb outside the Burj Khalifa which is the tallest building in Dubai. From the first Mission Impossible movie, Tom Cruise has always seemed to push the bar with new stunts that keeps the audience coming back for more. In the movie trailer, they show a scene where Tom Cruise is riding a dirt bike on the top of the mountain. As he speeds up to drop off the cliff, he let the dirt bike fell and parachuted his way to landing. These are the kind of intense stunts and scenes I enjoy watching. Hopefully the new Mission Impossible movie will surpass what movie viewers expected.Does any of you like this movie as much as I do?

comments.author: Jinx9975
comments.body: Here's a hypothetical blog post reviewing Mission Impossible 7:# Mission Actually Very Possible - Tom Cruise Delivers Again in MI7The long-awaited next installment in the death-defying Mission Impossible series has finally arrived and daredevil actor Tom Cruise doesn't disappoint in MI7. The 59-year old looks even more energized than ever taking his stunt work to outrageous new heights (quite literally!).In this adrenaline-pumping edition, Ethan Hunt and the Impossible Missions Force team take on their most personal threat yet - his own protégé gone rogue. We're introduced to a cunning new villain, Stefano, played convincingly by Nicholas Hoult. Stefano was once Hunt's star pupil being groomed to take over leadership one day. But certain revelations about his past send Stefano over the edge as he ends up using the IMF's own strategies against them. What follows is a blockbuster packed with edge-of-your-seat action sequences spanning exotic locales like Italy, Norway and Tunisia. Over the top? Sure, but hugely entertaining as we've come to expect.Highlights include Cruise clinging one-handed to a military fighter jet in midair and a motorcycle chase across cobblestone streets that leaves half of Rome in shambles. The well-orchestrated fight scenes and goosebump-inducing score by Hans Zimmer pull you right into the peril along with Ethan and his loyal crew.While the plot leaves some to be desired in terms of originality, it checks enough boxes to satisfy action genre fans. The impressive stunts and special effects are the real stars here. Tom Cruise has still got it, continuing to daredive into stunt work most actors his age (or half his age) wouldn’t dream of.Grade: A-
